conclusion: Liquid flows out from points A, B, and C at the top and the goal is to track the flow through barriers and rods into containers D or E.
There are barriers (green, white, and green) directly below points A, B, and C.
Container D is red and container E is green.
Liquid from A flows downward and encounters a green barrier.
Liquid from A is diverted by the red rod to the right.
Liquid from A flows past the blue rod, which doesn't block it.
Liquid from A encounters the white barrier, which diverts it downward.
Liquid from A flows into container E after passing under the blue and orange rods.
Liquid from B flows downward and encounters a white barrier.
Liquid from B is diverted to the right, flowing past the green rod.
Liquid from B encounters the purple rod, which doesn't block it.
Liquid from B flows into container D after passing under the purple rod.
Liquid from C flows downward and encounters a green barrier.
Liquid from C is diverted by the green rod to the right.
Liquid from C follows the path under the white barrier.
Liquid from C flows into container E after passing under the blue and orange rods.
Liquid from A flows into container E.
Liquid from B flows into container D.
Liquid from C flows into container E.
Container D receives liquid from B and container E receives liquid from A and C.
